newsitem.title: POLAND: Jutrzenka to issue one million new shares.
newsitem.headline: Jutrzenka to issue one million new shares.

text.p: Polish confectioner Jutrzenka SA plans to issue one million new common shares ex-rights to selected investors, the company said in a statement on Friday.
Jutrzenka said the decision must be approved by an extraordinary general shareholders meeting on December 7, which would authorise management to choose investors who offer the best price.

"Series E shares are designed only for investors who offer the highest price, for the development of the firm requires a group of institutional investors interested in holding onto their shares in the long term," the statement said.
It said the firm was seeking "serious financial investors" who would pay an amount based on Jutrenka's share price on the Warsaw bourse. Jutrzenka closed at 56 zlotys on the Warsaw bourse on Friday.
In October the firm, based in Bydgoszcz, northern Poland, said it was seeking a strategic or financial investor to take a minority stake.
Earlier this month Dutch-based Wood Securities BV underwrote one million shares of the prospective issue, of which 200,000 were sub-underwritten by PBR.
Jutrzenka, which netted 7.1 million zlotys last year and 8.8 million through the first 10 months of 1996, seeks to transfer next year to the Warsaw bourse's main market from the parallel floor.
